title: 114_hr6418
content: The "Drinking Water Affordability Act of 2016" may be cited as the short title. Amendments to the Safe Drinking Water Act are included in the Act. The "Drinking Water Affordability Act of 2016" includes amendments to the Safe Drinking Water Act, such as revisions to national drinking water regulations, enforcement updates, and changes to state revolving loan funds. The Drinking Water Act is amended to include provisions for fully amortized loans within 30 years of project completion, with the option for extended terms up to 40 years for disadvantaged communities. The Safe Drinking Water Act is amended to change the loan repayment period to 18 months after project completion. Amendments are also made to the administration of state loan funds and other authorized activities. The Safe Drinking Water Act is amended to extend the period for delineating, assessing, updating assessments, and implementing activities related to source water protection areas from fiscal years 2018 through 2024. Additionally, an exemption from federal cross-cutting requirements is added to the Act. The Safe Drinking Water Act is amended to extend the period for activities related to source water protection areas from fiscal years 2018 through 2024. An exemption from federal cross-cutting requirements is added to the Act. The Safe Drinking Water Act is amended to exempt public water systems receiving financial assistance from federal cross-cutting requirements if the state has an equivalent requirement. The Safe Drinking Water Act exempts public water systems from federal cross-cutting requirements if the state has an equivalent law. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report to Congress within 18 months of this Act's enactment. The report will include a study on cost-effective ways to rehabilitate or replace drinking water infrastructure to meet Safe Drinking Water Act goals, as well as an assessment of barriers preventing communities from using studied materials and technologies.
